Benchmark Multiple Learners on Multiple Tasks

Source: R/benchmark.R

Runs a benchmark of the cross-product of learners, tasks, and resampling strategies (possibly in parallel).

benchmark(tasks, learners, resamplings, measures = NULL,
  ctrl = mlr_control())

Arguments

tasks

[list of Task]:
List of objects of type Task.
learners

[list of Learner]:
List of objects of type Learner.
resamplings

[list of Resampling]:
List of objects of type Resampling.
measures

[list of Measure]:
List of performance measures used to assess the predictive performance. Defaults to the respective measures stored in task.
ctrl

[named list as returned by mlr_control()]:
Object to control experiment execution. See mlr_control().

Value

BenchmarkResult.

Examples

set.seed(123)
tasks = mlr_tasks$mget(c("iris", "sonar"))
learners = mlr_learners$mget(c("classif.dummy", "classif.rpart"))
resamplings = mlr_resamplings$mget(c("holdout", "cv"))
measures = mlr_measures$mget("acc")
ctrl = mlr_control()
ctrl$verbose = FALSE
bmr = benchmark(tasks, learners, resamplings, measures, ctrl = ctrl)

# performance for all conducted experiments
head(as.data.table(bmr))
#>                hash          task task_id               learner    learner_id
#> 1: 5d9b603446969261 <TaskClassif>   sonar <LearnerClassifRpart> classif.rpart
#> 2: fdfa483e082c1801 <TaskClassif>    iris <LearnerClassifRpart> classif.rpart
#> 3: 94963101e493fb84 <TaskClassif>    iris <LearnerClassifRpart> classif.rpart
#> 4: 8063303de91f8cf5 <TaskClassif>   sonar <LearnerClassifDummy> classif.dummy
#> 5: 5d9b603446969261 <TaskClassif>   sonar <LearnerClassifRpart> classif.rpart
#> 6: 84496cf112c22e0a <TaskClassif>    iris <LearnerClassifDummy> classif.dummy
#>             resampling resampling_id       acc
#> 1:      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.6190476
#> 2: <ResamplingHoldout>       holdout 0.9200000
#> 3:      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.9333333
#> 4:      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.5238095
#> 5:      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.6500000
#> 6:      <ResamplingCV>            cv 0.1333333

# aggregated performance
bmr$aggregated
#>                hash task_id    learner_id resampling_id       acc
#> 1: 5d9b603446969261   sonar classif.rpart            cv 0.7161905
#> 2: fdfa483e082c1801    iris classif.rpart       holdout 0.9200000
#> 3: 94963101e493fb84    iris classif.rpart            cv 0.9333333
#> 4: 8063303de91f8cf5   sonar classif.dummy            cv 0.5347619
#> 5: 84496cf112c22e0a    iris classif.dummy            cv 0.1933333
#> 6: 8c4d553709eae2b3    iris classif.dummy       holdout 0.2800000
#> 7: 70ee6246f6f933da   sonar classif.rpart       holdout 0.7536232
#> 8: 12211bd028dc0b96   sonar classif.dummy       holdout 0.5507246

# Overview of of resamplings that were conducted internally
rrs = bmr$resample_results
print(rrs)
#>                hash task_id    learner_id resampling_id  N
#> 1: 5d9b603446969261   sonar classif.rpart            cv 10
#> 2: fdfa483e082c1801    iris classif.rpart       holdout  1
#> 3: 94963101e493fb84    iris classif.rpart            cv 10
#> 4: 8063303de91f8cf5   sonar classif.dummy            cv 10
#> 5: 84496cf112c22e0a    iris classif.dummy            cv 10
#> 6: 8c4d553709eae2b3    iris classif.dummy       holdout  1
#> 7: 70ee6246f6f933da   sonar classif.rpart       holdout  1
#> 8: 12211bd028dc0b96   sonar classif.dummy       holdout  1

# Extract first ResampleResult
rr = bmr$resample_result(hash = rrs$hash[1])
print(rr)
#> ResampleResult of learner 'sonar' on task 'classif.rpart' with 10 iterations
#>  Measure      Min.   1st Qu.    Median      Mean  3rd Qu.      Max.        Sd
#>      acc 0.6190476 0.6267857 0.7321429 0.7161905 0.797619 0.8095238 0.0830403

# Extract predictions of first experiment of this resampling
head(rr$experiment(1)$prediction)
#>    id response truth
#> 1:  8        M     R
#> 2: 23        R     R
#> 3: 25        R     R
#> 4: 41        R     R
#> 5: 49        R     R
#> 6: 60        R     R
